meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Here comes the grokiest review of Songs of Conquest!

I'm not going to lie; I was skeptical at first. Another indie game trying to revive a beloved classic? Sounds like déjà vu all over again (thank you, Yogi). But oh boy, Lavapotion's turn-based tactics anthology is a real treat! It's like a warm hug from your gaming childhood self.

Now, let's get serious for a sec (just for a sec, I promise). Eurogamer thought the battles could be punishing and uneven at times. Okay, no one likes a tough fight, but that's what makes it so rewarding when you finally crush those pesky orcs! God is a Geek agrees; they think Songs of Conquest is a standout hit. I mean, who doesn't love a good underdog story?

IGN Italia raves about the game's respectful nods to Heroes of Might and Magic while still innovating with its own pixel art and gameplay tweaks. GameStar simply says it's got that classic HoMM3 magic (zing!). The Games Machine praises the balanced factions, community support, and sheer amount of content. PC Games calls it a well-made strategy game that'll keep you entertained for hours. And TheGamer just loves how welcoming the difficulty curve is!

So what do I think? Well, let's just say I'm having a blast playing Songs of Conquest! It's like Lavapotion took all the best parts of Heroes of Might and Magic and added their own special sauce (or should I say, hippo sauce?). The game's got charm, it's got depth, and most importantly, it's got fun!

That's all for today, folks! If you're looking for a great turn-based strategy game that'll transport you back to your gaming roots, look no further than Songs of Conquest!
